data.text:
Miki was a borderline Mary Sue again instead of the more flawed and far more creative manga portrayal of her (she was still better than most of her non-manga portrayals, I give her that), Ryo was a one-dimensional sociopath instead of the conflicted and complex creature he is, Akira never gave up on humanity as he should have (he does in the manga).

I do love superficial scenes getting adapted but it came off as superficial sometimes which ruined my enjoyment. Like how they could ruin the ending like that? The lesson in Devilman is that everyone contributed this to happen, Akira too. He spent decades slaughtering humanity or trampling on them because of his grudge and battle against Satan. That was the moral of the “horror” of war and that everyone was a demon. The baton-thing was a good idea for “symbolic” miscommunication but it fell short because it was impossible to communicate with Satan, unlike the manga, where you feel by the last scene that humanity and demons (which are revealed to be one and the same in Devilman Lady lol - demons are just a step up in natural evolution for men) could have been saved if the two of them stopped and talked things out.
